intro: Thibaudia tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its square stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Thibaudia tetragona is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
